title: Tip
data:
**[English]()**

 • [한국어](/wiki/Tip/ko "Tip/ko")

**#tip** is an [extended command](/wiki/Extended_command "Extended command") introduced in [NetHack 3.6.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.6.0 "NetHack 3.6.0") that allows you to empty the contents of a [container](/wiki/Container "Container"), either in your [inventory](/wiki/Inventory "Inventory") or on the floor.

## Description

Using #tip and then selecting an appropriate container will deposit that container's contents onto the ground. Bear in mind that this acts exactly as if you had dropped all items in the selected container onto the floor - if you are [levitating](/wiki/Levitating "Levitating"), any [fragile](/wiki/Fragile "Fragile") objects you drop will shatter upon impact.

Tipping a [bag of tricks](/wiki/Bag_of_tricks "Bag of tricks") or [horn of plenty](/wiki/Horn_of_plenty "Horn of plenty") will use up all its charges in one turn, producing multiple monsters or comestibles as appropriate.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1) Tipping over an [ice box](/wiki/Ice_box "Ice box") will render all the [corpses](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse") within unfit for [sacrifice](/wiki/Sacrifice "Sacrifice").

Tipping a container you own in a [shop](/wiki/Shop "Shop") will automatically sell the contents to its shopkeeper.

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([3.7.0](/wiki/3.7.0 "3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

Tipping your worn helmet while next to a monster acts in a similar way to #chat, but may elicit different responses.

## Strategy

Tipping is especially useful when you have [no hands free](/wiki/Two-handed#Wielding_cursed_two-handers "Two-handed"), and you need to retrieve some [curse removal](/wiki/Curse_removal "Curse removal") item from your bag.

Some characters carry a second bag with one [scroll of scare monster](/wiki/Scroll_of_scare_monster "Scroll of scare monster") and a few other objects such as a [potion of holy water](/wiki/Potion_of_holy_water "Potion of holy water"). In an emergency, the player can tip the secondary bag, putting the scroll of scare monster onto the ground in one action, without putting all the contents of their primary bag on the ground along with it.

If you encounter a [container](/wiki/Container "Container") with an unidentified [gray stone](/wiki/Gray_stone "Gray stone"), you can tip the container to put the stone on the floor so that you can kick-test it.

If you encounter a cursed [bag of holding](/wiki/Bag_of_holding "Bag of holding") in a [bones](/wiki/Bones "Bones") pile, and you are unable to uncurse the bag, then you can tip the bag to obtain most of the objects inside. 12/13 of the objects will go onto the floor and 1/13 of the objects will be lost.

If you are in a hurry and/or using a (preferably spare) container, tipping can be used to sell off junk and other items quickly in shops, or else mass-identify their beatitudes on an [altar](/wiki/Altar "Altar").

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [pickup.c in NetHack 3.6.1, line 3058](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.1_Release/pickup.c#L3058)

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.6. Click here for more information.](/images/5/57/Nh366-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.6. Click here for more information.")
html:
Tip

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
English

 • 한국어

#tip is an extended command introduced in NetHack 3.6.0 that allows you to empty the contents of a container, either in your inventory or on the floor.

Description

Using #tip and then selecting an appropriate container will deposit that container's contents onto the ground. Bear in mind that this acts exactly as if you had dropped all items in the selected container onto the floor - if you are levitating, any fragile objects you drop will shatter upon impact.

Tipping a bag of tricks or horn of plenty will use up all its charges in one turn, producing multiple monsters or comestibles as appropriate.[1] Tipping over an ice box will render all the corpses within unfit for sacrifice.

Tipping a container you own in a shop will automatically sell the contents to its shopkeeper.

The following information pertains to an upcoming version (3.7.0). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.

Tipping your worn helmet while next to a monster acts in a similar way to #chat, but may elicit different responses.

Strategy

Tipping is especially useful when you have no hands free, and you need to retrieve some curse removal item from your bag.

Some characters carry a second bag with one scroll of scare monster and a few other objects such as a potion of holy water. In an emergency, the player can tip the secondary bag, putting the scroll of scare monster onto the ground in one action, without putting all the contents of their primary bag on the ground along with it.

If you encounter a container with an unidentified gray stone, you can tip the container to put the stone on the floor so that you can kick-test it.

If you encounter a cursed bag of holding in a bones pile, and you are unable to uncurse the bag, then you can tip the bag to obtain most of the objects inside. 12/13 of the objects will go onto the floor and 1/13 of the objects will be lost.

If you are in a hurry and/or using a (preferably spare) container, tipping can be used to sell off junk and other items quickly in shops, or else mass-identify their beatitudes on an altar.

References

  1. ↑ pickup.c in NetHack 3.6.1, line 3058

rawPage:
{{languages}}
'''#tip''' is an [[extended command]] introduced in [[NetHack 3.6.0]] that allows you to empty the contents of a [[container]], either in your [[inventory]] or on the floor.

==Description==
Using #tip and then selecting an appropriate container will deposit that container's contents onto the ground. Bear in mind that this acts exactly as if you had dropped all items in the selected container onto the floor - if you are [[levitating]], any [[fragile]] objects you drop will shatter upon impact.

Tipping a [[bag of tricks]] or [[horn of plenty]] will use up all its charges in one turn, producing multiple monsters or comestibles as appropriate.{{refsrc|pickup.c|3058|nethack=3.6.1}} Tipping over an [[ice box]] will render all the [[corpse]]s within unfit for [[sacrifice]].

Tipping a container you own in a [[shop]] will automatically sell the contents to its shopkeeper.

{{upcoming|3.7.0|Tipping your worn helmet while next to a monster acts in a similar way to #chat, but may elicit different responses.}}

==Strategy==
Tipping is especially useful when you have [[Two-handed#Wielding cursed two-handers|no hands free]], and you need to retrieve some [[curse removal]] item from your bag.

Some characters carry a second bag with one [[scroll of scare monster]] and a few other objects such as a [[potion of holy water]]. In an emergency, the player can tip the secondary bag, putting the scroll of scare monster onto the ground in one action, without putting all the contents of their primary bag on the ground along with it.

If you encounter a [[container]] with an unidentified [[gray stone]], you can tip the container to put the stone on the floor so that you can kick-test it.

If you encounter a cursed [[bag of holding]] in a [[bones]] pile, and you are unable to uncurse the bag, then you can tip the bag to obtain most of the objects inside. 12/13 of the objects will go onto the floor and 1/13 of the objects will be lost.

If you are in a hurry and/or using a (preferably spare) container, tipping can be used to sell off junk and other items quickly in shops, or else mass-identify their beatitudes on an [[altar]].
